link.synopsis: This award-winning comedy follows the misadventures of neurotic Edina (Jennifer Saunders) and party girl Patsy (Joanna Lumley): lifelong best friends, successful career women and the most self-centered, pleasure-seeking pair ever to pass out in an English nightclub. Eddy's studious daughter, Saffy (Julia Sawalha), tries to keep her mum on the straight and narrow but is always thwarted by Patsy's dubious invitations of drugs, booze and men.
link.title: synopsis
French & Saunders: Gentlemen Prefer French & Saunders
French & Saunders: Back with a Vengeance
French & Saunders: Living in a Material World
The Life and Times of Vivienne Vyle
Keeping Up Appearances: Life Lessons from Onslow
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
Are You Being Served? Again: The Complete Series
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 1
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Molly Shannon
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Adam Sandler
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dana Carvey

link.synopsis: Bollywood stars Imran Khan and Kareena Kapoor pair up to play exceptionally dissimilar lovers in this lighthearted romantic comedy, portraying a buttoned-up architect and the free-spirited hairstylist he falls in love with, respectively.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this farcical sex comedy, three male also-rans in the art of love find a magical shirt that makes the wearer irresistible to any and all women. They happily employ the shirt's powers until one of them uses the shirt to try and win his wife back.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
National Lampoon Presents: One, Two, Many
National Lampoon Presents Jake's Booty Call
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human
The Night of the White Pants
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: In this comedy that pokes fun at the yuppie lifestyle, Dino Garcia stars as José, a single guy content with his life, which includes good friends, a pretty girlfriend and an array of options. But when his sweetheart announces she's pregnant, the couple rushes into a shotgun marriage -- and the future begins to evaporate. Strapped with a baby, a car payment, a higher rent and a mountain of bills, it's a good thing at least his wife's love is free!
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this campy, sci-fi comedy, deranged Dr. Goldfoot (Vincent Price) invents a machine that turns out an army of bikini-clad sirens programmed to seduce the world's wealthiest men into signing over their fortunes. But when secret agent Craig Gamble (Frankie Avalon) discovers the evil conspiracy, he knows he must destroy the gorgeous gold diggers before losing his heart -- and possibly his life -- to the hottest assassins on the planet.
link.title: synopsis
Dr. Goldfoot and the Girl Bombs
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
The Masque of the Red Death
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
To Be or Not To Be

title.regular: Dr. Goldfoot and the Bikini Machine
title.short: Dr. Goldfoot and the Bikini Machine

link.synopsis: A hack 1920s playwright (John Cusack) uses a mobster to finance his newest play. But when the gangster's bodyguard (Chazz Palminteri) starts rewriting the play to make it more believable, he shows more talent than the play's original author. Dianne Wiest steals the show as a haughty actress in this light-as-air period comedy, which ranks as one of Woody Allen's best films. Jim Broadbent, Mary-Louise Parker and Jennifer Tilly co-star.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture

link.synopsis: In director John Landis's slapstick comedy of errant espionage, it's up to Emmett (Chevy Chase) and Austin (Dan Aykroyd) -- two CIA spies who have never left their boring offices in Washington, D.C. -- to save the world from nuclear disaster. Trouble begins when the duo enters the Soviet Union via Afghanistan while trying to avoid detection by the Russian army and rival spies. Look for Terry Gilliam, Sam Raimi and Joel Coen in cameos.
link.title: synopsis
The Man with One Red Shoe
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
Get Smart's Bruce & Lloyd Out of Control
The Man Who Knew Too Little
Dr. Goldfoot and the Girl Bombs

link.synopsis: The potty-mouthed youngsters of "South Park" co-creators Trey Parker and Matt Stone move from cable television to the big screen in this Oscar-nominated animated comedy. With a loose plot involving Satan, Saddam Hussein and the corruption of American youth via their Canadian neighbors, this film boasts old-school animation, dialogue to make the censors blush and catchy songs with clever, often profane lyrics.
link.title: synopsis
South Park: The Passion of the Jew
Meet the Spartans: Unrated Pit of Death Edition
Aqua Teen Hunger Force Colon Movie Film for Theaters
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!
Family Guy Presents: Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story
South Park: The Cult of Cartman
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
The Haunted World of El Superbeasto

title.regular: South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
title.short: South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut

link.synopsis: Incompetent mayor Italo Bombolini (Anthony Quinn) rises to the occasion when his small Italian town is threatened by approaching Nazis planning to seize the town's supply of valuable wine near the end of World War II. Organizing the locals, he facilitates a plan to hide a million bottles in a nearby cave. Anna Magnani, Virna Lisi and Hardy Krüger co-star in Stanley Kramer's appealing comedy, which garnered a Golden Globe for Best Film.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Russians Are Coming, The Russians Are Coming
The Heart Is a Lonely Hunter
The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
Suppose They Gave a War and Nobody Came?

link.synopsis: Renowned playwright and funnyman Tyler Perry -- author of Madea's Family Reunion and Diary of a Mad Black Woman -- penned this play about the ups and downs of wedded life. When a gorgeous seductress inserts herself into the middle of a marriage, the couple finds themselves on shaky ground. Soon their entire extended family becomes involved in saving their marriage. Cheryl Pepsii Riley stars in this amusing comedy, along with LaVan Davis and Donna Stewart.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry: What's Done in the Dark
Diary of a Mad Black Woman: The Play
I Can Do Bad All By Myself
What a Man Wants, What a Woman Needs
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?
Tyler Perry's The Family That Preys
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family: The Play
Beauty Shop: The Original Stage Play
Tyler Perry's Laugh to Keep from Crying
Diary of a Mad Black Woman
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
I Think I Love My Wife
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
He's Just Not That Into You
A Good Man Is Hard to Find

link.synopsis: French filmmaker Jean-Pierre Jeunet takes a satirical look at the global arms trade with this foreign-language comedy starring Dany Boon as Bazil, who rallies his friends to take down weapons manufacturers responsible for his father's death. Bazil also discovers a dump into an underground haven for cool tools and sculptures crafted from discarded junk. Dominique Pinon, André Dussollier and Jean-Pierre Marielle co-star.
link.title: synopsis
A Woman, a Gun and a Noodle Shop
A Complete History of My Sexual Failures
The Beat That My Heart Skipped
The Diving Bell and the Butterfly
National Lampoon Presents: The Beach Party at the Threshold of Hell
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: Col. John Matrix (Arnold Schwarzenegger), the former leader of a special ops team, is vaulted back into action to save his young daughter (Alyssa Milano) who has been kidnapped. Her life is threatened lest John assassinate a South American president. Rather than being strong-armed into such a proposition, John takes matters (and lots of guns) into his owns hands as he fights through the jungle against his enemies to save his daughter.
link.title: synopsis
To Live and Die in L.A.

link.synopsis: Smooth-talking mental patient Mickey (Keith Carradine) frequents a local bar after escaping from his ward and unwittingly brings together several lost souls in this romantic comedy marked by hilarious, moving and thought-provoking moments. Radio sex therapist Dr. Nancy Love (Genevieve Bujold), bar owner Eve (Lesley Ann Warren) and aspiring poetess Pearl (Rae Dawn Chong) all find themselves drawn to Mickey, who ends up transforming their lives.
link.title: synopsis
A Woman, Her Men and Her Futon
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: Outrageous comedy troupe Broken Lizard -- the twisted minds behind Beerfest and Super Troopers -- presents a raucous night of stand-up comedy filmed during a live performance in Los Angeles. No topic is off-limits, from sex to drugs and beyond. Longtime friends Jay Chandrasekhar, Kevin Heffernan, Steve Lemme, Paul Soter and Erik Stolhanske delve into their psyches to mine comedy gold, ending the evening with the riotous story of how they met.
link.title: synopsis
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Aziz Ansari: Intimate Moments for a Sensual Evening
I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell
An Evening with Kevin Smith 2: Evening Harder
Sold Out: A Threevening with Kevin Smith
Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America: A Final Night with George W. Bush
Inside the Actors Studio: Dave Chappelle
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 3
Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Jamie Foxx Unleashed: Lost, Stolen and Leaked!
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Comedy Jump Off: The Latino Connection
Katt Williams: The Pimp Chronicles: Pt. 1
National Lampoon Live: New Faces: Vol. 1

link.synopsis: Up-and-coming booker Danny is on the lookout for the next big thing in comedy. He finds just that when he meets the sexy Alex (Suki Webster) and teams her up with irreverent comedy duo Gus and Jay (David Schneider and Neil Mullarkey). The trio hit it big, becoming the toast of London's urban comedy circuit. But infighting, drugs and sexual obsession threaten to take it all away. Comedy is no laughing matter in this comedy-drama.
link.title: synopsis
Cadfael: A Morbid Taste for Bones
Franz Kafka's It's a Wonderful Life and Other Strange Tales
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story

link.synopsis: After a botched sex-change operation, East German glam rocker Hansel (John Cameron Mitchell) becomes Hedwig and travels across the United States with a stage show, following her ex-boyfriend (and former band mate) and telling her life story. Hedwig's offbeat show slays audiences -- but in diners not clubs. Mitchell also wrote and directed the comedy, which won at the Sundance Film Festival and was nominated for several Independent Spirit Awards.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Follow My Voice: With the Music of Hedwig
The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
Fabulous! The Story of Queer Cinema
Down and Out With the Dolls
Love and Death on Long Island
The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou

link.synopsis: Free-spirited Ivy League freshman "Gib" Gibson (John Cusack) makes plans to visit his friend in California over winter break, with the promise of a hot babe awaiting his arrival. But he's stuck driving cross-country with studious Alison (Daphne Zuniga), who can't stand him. But along the way, they come to eventually tolerate each other ... and perhaps even a bit more. Rob Reiner directs this coming-of-age romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: A young family moves into their dream house on Copley Lane, but Alex (David Sullivan), Heather (Heather Pikas) and their daughter soon begin to suspect that the building is also home to the spirits of several past residents, who may not be pleased with the new occupants. As the mysterious nighttime specters become more active, the couple starts to question their grasp on  reality and must seek help in this terrifying ghost story.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: As if getting out the door for a blind date isn't hard enough, 30-something Arliss (Mitch Rouse) winds up with a gun-toting psychotic in this comedy-drama. When skinny blonde Jasmine answers his personal ad, Arliss heads out to meet her. Instead, he gets in a heated talk with Jasmine's opposite (Janeane Garofalo). Turns out the unstable woman is Jasmine -- &NFi;and&NFi_; she's got a gun, &NFi;and&NFi_; it's her birthday. Margaret Cho and Bob Goldthwait co-star.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Don't Touch Me
Janeane Garofalo: If You Will: Live in Seattle
A Woman, Her Men and Her Futon

link.synopsis: Filmmaker Marco Wilms summons the creative spirits of East Germany's rigid past by throwing a party for designer Sabine von Oettingen, shutterbug Robert Paris, and stylist and hairdresser Frank Schäfer and inviting them to discuss their lives. As eccentric artists living beneath the weight of the Berlin Wall, they were forced to invent their own avant-garde styles. The results were typically off the wall -- and always fabulous.
link.title: synopsis
Harlan: In the Shadow of Jew Süss
The Net: The Unabomber, LSD and the Internet
The Life and Art of Ernst Ludwig Kirchner
Vision: From the Life of Hildegard von Bingen

link.synopsis: A straight-laced father tries to control his free-spirited son in this romantic comedy. Fed up with his son's wild ways, Mr. Wallace (Reginald Barlow) forces him to take a job as a collections agent. But Dick (John Wayne) falls for Marion (Evalyn Knapp), whose grandfather is overdue on his payments. Wallace is convinced Marion's a gold-digger and forbids the relationship, so she takes a job at his office to prove she's daughter-in-law material.
link.title: synopsis
I Was a Male War Bride
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
The Last Time I Saw Archie

link.synopsis: When he accidentally takes possession of a top-secret invisibility potion while en route to his wedding, government bureaucrat Sam Cooper (Steve Guttenberg) finds himself engulfed in a madcap free-for-all as Russians and other bad guys try to get the substance. To elude the Reds, his own State Department bosses and his livid fiancée, Cooper takes the vanishing juice himself -- which only makes matters worse. Bruce Malmuth directs this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Dr. Goldfoot and the Girl Bombs
Timerider: The Adventure of Lyle Swann
Allan Quatermain and the Temple of Skulls
How to Beat the High Cost of Living

link.synopsis: After his father dies, Josh Framm (Kevin Zegers) adopts Buddy, an abandoned dog, just as the boy and his mother move to a new town. Too shy to play basketball, Josh instead manages the team but one night discovers that Buddy can sink hoops. Soon, Buddy's skills inspire the team, helping take them all the way to the championships in director Charles Martin Smith's family comedy that tackles loneliness, hope, wonder -- and a most unusual pet.
link.title: synopsis
The Adventures of Milo and Otis
Homeward Bound 2: Lost in San Francisco
Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat

link.synopsis: Jim Carrey gives the performance of his career as the insanely inventive comedian Andy Kaufman, best known as lovable mechanic Latka Gravas on the 1970s sitcom "Taxi," who shocked audiences with his caustic, off-the-wall routines. Director Milos Forman vividly recreates the era (with help from Lorne Michaels and David Letterman, who play themselves) and profiles a man who often blended comedy with performance art.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

link.title: Andy Kaufman: I'm from Hollywood/My Breakfast with Blassie
Andy Kaufman: The Andy Kaufman Show: Soundstage
The Life & Death of Peter Sellers
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
Man on the Moon with Walter Cronkite
Why Do Fools Fall in Love

link.synopsis: John Landis's groundbreaking comedy features a lewd, loosely connected collection of skits that spoof blaxploitation films, news shows, porno movies, TV commercials, kung fu flicks and more.
link.title: synopsis
The Nine Lives of Fritz the Cat
Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut

link.synopsis: Set against the backdrop of the Big Apple, director Mark Levin's (Wimbledon) quirky tale of first love puts the spotlight on pint-sized passion as young urbanites Gabe (Josh Hutcherson) and Rosemary (Charlie Ray) explore their budding emotions. And there's one thing that makes them perfect for each other: They're both in the fifth grade. Cynthia Nixon and Bradley Whitford co-star in this winning comedy that proves bigger isn't necessarily better.
link.title: synopsis
Hannah Montana: One in a Million
Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Rodrick Rules
As Told by Ginger: Far from Home
All Grown Up!: All Grown Up ... and Loving It!
All Grown Up!: R.V. Having Fun Yet?
All Grown Up!: Growing Up Changes Everything

link.synopsis: Poking fun at contemporary films such as The Grudge, War of the Worlds, Million Dollar Baby, The Village and Saw II, legendary comedy director David Zucker takes the successful Scary Movie franchise and stretches it even further.
link.title: synopsis
Meet the Spartans: Unrated Pit of Death Edition
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
I Know What You Did Last Summer
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry

link.synopsis: When a boxer turned restaurateur (Michael Clarke Duncan) announces a contest to his waitstaff, the good news is that the winner will get a $10,000 bonus. The bad news? The loser will be on the receiving end of a heavy-duty smack-down at the hands of the champ himself. Director Kevin Heffernan co-stars alongside fellow Broken Lizard comedy vets Steve Lemme, Paul Soter, Erik Stolhanske and Jay Chandrasekhar.
link.title: synopsis
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It
Seth MacFarlane's Cavalcade of Cartoon Comedy: Uncensored
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
The Night of the White Pants

link.synopsis: Hoping that his novel brings him fame and fortune, high school loner Benjamin Purvis (Michael Angarano) attends a fantasy writers conference and later discovers that his masterwork has been plagiarized by an iconic author (Jemaine Clement, "Flight of the Conchords"). Sam Rockwell, Jennifer Coolidge and Mike White also star in this quirky comedy from co-writer-director Jared Hess (Napoleon Dynamite, Nacho Libre).
link.title: synopsis
Seth MacFarlane's Cavalcade of Cartoon Comedy: Uncensored
Family Guy: Something, Something, Something, Dark Side
It's Kind of a Funny Story

link.synopsis: Often called "the black American Graffiti," this film follows aspiring writer Preach (Glynn Turman) and basketball star Cochise (Lawrence-Hilton Jacobs) as they drift through their classes and wander around their Chicago neighborhood in the 1960s, pulling pranks and trying to enjoy life in an impoverished urban environment. When they take a joyride in a stolen car with a pair of local hoods, their carefree existence takes a turn for the dramatic.
link.title: synopsis
Five on the Black Hand Side
The Outsiders - The Complete Novel Extended Edition

link.synopsis: Proving that flesh-eating monsters don't practice age discrimination, this black comedy tells the tale of elderly Emily Dwyer (Jeanne Bates), who takes a suspicious lodger into her Los Angeles home. After being bitten by him, she develops a taste for her son, Clay (Mark Thomas Miller). Desperate to keep his mother from committing homicide, Clay has her incarcerated, but after she escapes he must take matters into his own hands.
link.title: synopsis
Blood Feast 2: All U Can Eat
Masters of Horror: Larry Cohen: Pick Me Up
Masters of Horror: Don Coscarelli: Incident On and Off a Mountain Road

link.synopsis: Jackie Chan stars in this parody of American Westerns as Chon Wang, a clumsy imperial guard who trails Princess Pei Pei (Lucy Liu) when she is kidnapped from the Forbidden City and transported to America. Wang follows her captors to Nevada, where he teams up with an unlikely partner, outcast outlaw Roy O'Bannon (Owen Wilson), and tries to spring the princess from her imprisonment in this charming action-comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: George C. Scott stars in this 1974 romp that critic Leonard Maltin calls a "fast-paced, nutty comedy." A bank is being temporarily housed in a mobile home while a new building is constructed. Seems like an easy target to break into for a band of crooks, right? But they've come up with an even better idea: steal the whole bank and rob it in a safer location!
link.title: synopsis
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
The Murders in the Rue Morgue

link.synopsis: When the men of a Sicilian village start obsessing over ravishing blonde midwife Jessica (Angie Dickinson), angry females revolt by refusing to have sex with their husbands. As the local priest (Maurice Chevalier) tries to encourage procreation, Jessica falls for a tricky recluse (Gabriele Ferzetti). An adaptation of a Flora Sandstrom novel, this charming comedy also features Noel-Noel as a matchmaking old-timer.
link.title: synopsis
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
Dr. Goldfoot and the Girl Bombs
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!

link.synopsis: The Coen brothers deliver a screwball comedy gem about mail clerk Norville Barnes, (Tim Robbins) who falls into good -- or bad? -- luck when he becomes the CEO of a successful business. The evil Sidney J. Mussberger (Paul Newman) chooses Barnes so he and the other board directors can make a fortune on the falling stock price. Meanwhile, reporter Amy Archer (Jennifer Jason Leigh) befriends Norville in hopes of landing a big scoop.
link.title: synopsis
Bang the Drum Slowly / The Battler

link.synopsis: When Maggie and Sammy miss their school field trip, Maggie's divorced dad and Sammy's divorced mom are forced to work together in this charming romantic comedy. At first, the grown-ups are at odds, but they warm to each other as the day progresses.
link.title: synopsis
I Could Never Be Your Woman
The Cutting Edge: Going for the Gold

link.synopsis: The Marx Brothers -- Groucho, Harpo and Chico -- wreak havoc in the opera house in one of their biggest hits. Penned by Morrie Ryskind and George S. Kaufman, the film contains perhaps the greatest Marx comedy bit ever: the crowded stateroom scene. Kitty Carlisle and Allan Jones are charming as the singing romantic leads whom the Marxes help transform into big-time opera stars. This was the first MGM film for the Marxes.
link.title: synopsis
Marx Brothers: Marx Brothers Mixed Nuts
Marx Brothers: Inside the Marx Brothers
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: My Little Chickadee
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: It's a Gift
You Can't Take It with You

link.synopsis: It's a laugh-fest of epic proportions as the Spartans of 300 battle the Persian army à la Stomp the Yard in this no-holds-barred comedy that lampoons -- among others -- Meet the Parents, Pirates of the Caribbean, Britney Spears and Lindsay Lohan. Carmen Electra, Kevin Sorbo, Greg Ellis, Diedrich Bader and Sean Maguire star in this quirky satire from the zany minds behind the Scary Movie franchise.
link.title: synopsis
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me

title.regular: Meet the Spartans: Unrated Pit of Death Edition

link.synopsis: Rather than living the good life he'd imagined, newly retired Gianni spends his days running errands for those around him. Bemoaning his fate, he decides to take a mistress -- a task that proves easier said than done in this wistful comedy.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: On the verge of their first intimate encounter together, two teenage sweethearts find their plans thrown into peril. In their village, all the women are preparing to go on a sex strike against the men, who've been too lazy to fix broken water pipes. Starring Max Mauff and Kristyna Malérová, this romantic comedy was inspired by actual events in which women of a Turkish village withheld physical favors from their menfolk.
link.title: synopsis
Alix Lambert's The Mark of Cain
How Tasty Was My Little Frenchman
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: Tired of churning out fluffy comedies, Hollywood director John L. Sullivan (Joel McCrea) decides to write a serious, socially responsible film about human suffering. When his producers point out that he knows nothing of hardship, he hits the road as a hobo. On his journey, Sullivan invites an out-of-work actress (Veronica Lake) to be his traveling companion, and the pair get into more trouble than they ever dreamed of.
link.title: synopsis
I Was a Male War Bride
You Can't Take It with You
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp

link.synopsis: Wildly popular stand-up comedian Larry the Cable Guy (aka Daniel Whitney) sits upon the Comedy Central Roast throne as friends and comedy comrades hurl one inspired insult after another in his direction. Among those lampooning the lovable buffoon famous for growling "Git-R-Done!" are fellow "Blue Collar Comedy Tour" vets Jeff Foxworthy and Bill Engvall, actors Gary Busey and Maureen McCormick, country singer Toby Keith and more.
link.title: synopsis
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: One for the Road
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Working Class Comics
Larry the Cable Guy: Tailgate Party
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie
Larry the Cable Guy: Morning Constitutions
Lisa Lampanelli: Long Live the Queen
Lisa Lampanelli: Dirty Girl: No Protection
Lisa Lampanelli: Take It Like a Man
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
TK Kirkland: Are There Any Questions?
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Bobby Jones: Comedy All Stars: Vol. 1
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place
Jason Stuart: Making It to the Middle

title.regular: Roast of Larry the Cable Guy
title.short: Roast of Larry the Cable Guy

link.synopsis: German director Michael Haneke's stunning drama carefully interweaves the stories of a promising actress (Juliette Binoche), her photojournalist boyfriend (Thierry Neuvic), a young teacher of African descent (Ona Lu Yenke) and a Romanian illegal immigrant (Luminita Gheorghiu).On a bustling Paris street corner, their lives intersect for a fleeting moment, setting into motion a compelling portrait of life in a fractured, lonely world.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Let Me Die on a Sunday

link.synopsis: Hard-edged cop John Kimble (Arnold Schwarzenegger) gets more than he bargained for when he goes undercover as a kindergarten teacher to get the goods on a brutal drug lord (Richard Tyson) while at the same time protecting the man's young son. Pitted against a class of boisterous moppets whose antics try his patience and test his mettle, Kimble may have met his match … in more ways than one. Pamela Reed also stars in this engaging action comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Three Men and a Little Lady

link.synopsis: With the title of "Filthiest Person Alive" at stake, Babs Johnson (Divine), her degenerate son and dim-bulb mother face stiff competition from the vile Marble clan (David Lochary and Mink Stole) in an unbridled assault on every taboo in the book. Incest, drug trafficking, bestiality and an egg fetish are merely the tip of the proverbial iceberg in this controversial ultra-black comedy from renegade filmmaker John Waters.
link.title: synopsis
Beyond the Valley of the Dolls
The Nine Lives of Fritz the Cat
The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
The Decline of the American Empire

link.synopsis: When three college pals hit the road to compete in a big-time beer pong tournament, their trip morphs into an odyssey through such perils of the highway as a gun-wielding hitchhiker babe, three lovely strippers and a busload of other busty beauties. Will these sirens lead the boys astray, or can they make the tourney in time to win beer pong glory? Steve Rash directs, and Preston Jones stars in this sequel to the 2000 comedy hit Road Trip.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
Last Cup: Road to the World Series of Beer Pong
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son

link.synopsis: Set in Hollywood, this made-for-television comedy stars Bess Armstrong as B.T. Brady, a private eye hired by noted mystery novelist Harrison Wooly (José Ferrer) to safeguard his latest manuscript from a shadowy figure who slays the writer in an attempt to get it. Now, Brady must solve the case before the killer discovers that she possesses the document. Jerry Jameson (The Red Phone: Manhunt) directs.
link.title: synopsis
P.D. James: Death of an Expert Witness
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun
P.D. James: A Taste for Death
The Murders in the Rue Morgue
Joe Dancer: The Big Black Pill
In the Arms of a Killer
Wire in the Blood: Prayer of the Bone
Perry Mason: The Case of the Poisoned Pen

link.synopsis: Ten years after graduation, high school musical star Marc Pease (Jason Schwartzman) remains stuck in his glory days. But he's given a chance to face his past once and for all when he helps out his old teacher and mentor Mr. Gribble (Ben Stiller) on a new production. Meanwhile, current senior and Tony nominee Meg Brickman (Anna Kendrick) romantically attaches herself to both men in this offbeat comedy from Todd Louiso (Love Liza).
link.title: synopsis
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay

link.synopsis: Nicholas Turturro co-stars with his son in this charming comedy about a struggling actor, Gianni DiCarlo, deported to Mexico by rogue U.S. immigration agents. Lost and alone, Gianni wrestles with his identity as he confronts life south of the border. During his desperate attempts to return home, Gianni's new friends -- a group of unruly orphans -- help him thwart the Mexican police. Talia Shire and Paul Rodriguez also star.
link.title: synopsis
The Brady Bunch in the White House
ESL: English as a Second Language

link.synopsis: Noel Langley's drawing-room comedy is brought to the big screen with Heather Thatcher as Lady Buckering, a financially embarrassed, upper-class widow who is exasperated by her four adult daughters and their various romantic difficulties. While Doreen (Diane Hart) and her husband, Dougall (Richard Attenborough), await the birth of their first child, Dr. Drew (George Thorpe) urges Lady Buckering to marry him and a pilfering servant is apprehended.
link.title: synopsis
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?

link.synopsis: Moonstruck sixth-form misfit Daniel Gale (Robert Pattinson) woos mouthy schoolmate Charlotte Cooper (Holly Grainger) but finds himself swapping bouquets for baby advice when she shares the secret that she might be pregnant in this charming slice-of-teen-life comedy-drama. Daniel's fancy proves more than fair weather as Charlotte heads gamely toward a future her own single mum, Karen (Catherine Tate), is determined won't turn out as hers did.
link.title: synopsis
Robsessed: Inside the Life of Robert Pattinson

link.synopsis: Figure skating star Chris Linden (three-time Olympic gold medalist Sonja Henie) and ice hockey champ Don Martin (Michael O'Shea) make a passionate pair. When her beau's bad-boy behavior gets him booted from hockey, Chris lands him a spot in an ice show. But a battle with booze -- and the allure of another woman  -- may put Don on thin ice. Featuring plenty of stunning skating scenes, this musical comedy classic co-stars Marie McDonald.
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
There's No Business Like Show Business
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: Based on a novel by Colin Bateman (who also penned the screenplay), this pitch-black romantic comedy concerns a hard-drinking Irish tabloid journalist who strays from his wife, inadvertently crosses an unforgiving criminal and winds up in a big mess.
link.title: synopsis
The Inner Life of Martin Frost
A Film with Me in It

link.synopsis: With two of his sons trying to muster up enough souls to oust Old Scratch (Harvey Keitel) from power, the netherworld patriarch sends his sweet, dim-bulb son Nicky (Adam Sandler) to Earth to bring back his scheming siblings. Meanwhile, they're turning Manhattan into a living hell. This devilish comedy revels in crass humor and teems with gag cameos (many by Sandler's onetime "Saturday Night Live" co-stars, including Dana Carvey and Kevin Nealon).
link.title: synopsis
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery

link.synopsis: After a man's wife has gone seven years missing at sea (and is long believed dead), she suddenly shows up on the very day he's about to marry again! Cary Grant stars as the beleaguered husband, and Irene Dunne is hilarious as his returning wife. She -- on top of everything else -- must adjust to a hectic life far removed from the island where she was marooned. Garson Kanin directs this comedy, which received three Oscar nods.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Art Direction Black and White nominee
category.term: Best Art Direction Black and White nominee

link.title: Irene Dunne Romance Classics: Love Affair / Penny Serenade
I Was a Male War Bride
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
You Can't Take It with You
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife

link.synopsis: When an infant named Mary is left on their doorstep, three bachelor roommates (Tom Selleck, Steve Guttenberg and Ted Danson) channel their feminine side and become surrogate parents to the tyke. After a few false starts, the guys eventually take to their little bundle of joy. But questions linger about the baby's real origins, and why drug dealers are taking an interest in their life. Leonard Nimoy returns to Earth to direct this hit family comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Three Men and a Little Lady
Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold

link.synopsis: In this sequel to Disney's popular comedy adventure, Don Knotts and Tim Conway return as the two inept outlaws from the Apple Dumpling Gang. Determined to go straight, they roll into Junction City … and are promptly framed for a bank robbery. From there, every attempt to straighten out their situation results in more bumbling mayhem. Veteran Disney director Vincent McEveety helms this slapstick Western co-starring Harry Morgan and Ruth Buzzi.
link.title: synopsis
The Strongest Man in the World
Now You See Him, Now You Don't
The Shakiest Gun in the West
The Care Bears Movie II: A New Generation
The Looney, Looney, Looney Bugs Bunny Movie

title.regular: The Apple Dumpling Gang Rides Again
title.short: The Apple Dumpling Gang Rides Again

link.synopsis: In the process of undergoing a risky experimental surgery that could partially restore his eyesight, Danny (Chris Pine), a blind 20-something, meets the woman of his dreams (Anjali Jay), only to find out that she's been promised to another guy (Sendhil Ramamurthy). But if love is really blind, then Danny has the odds on his side. Eddie Kaye Thomas (American Pie) co-stars in this contemporary romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Other End of the Line
Jack and Jill vs. the World
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: To infinity and beyond! Buzz Lightyear (voiced by Tim Allen), everyone's favorite Space Ranger from the Academy Award-winning Toy Story movies, is here with an exciting interstellar space adventure all his own. Joined by Star Command team members Mira Nova, the psychic princess, bumbling newbie Booster and XR, the experimental robot, Buzz defends the planet of the Little Green Men against the devious plots of the evil Emperor Zurg.
link.title: synopsis
Penguins of Madagascar: New to the  Zoo
LEGO: The Adventures of Clutch Powers
LEGO: Hero Factory: Rise of the Rookies
Playmobil: The Secret of Pirate Island
Penguins of Madagascar: Happy King Julien Day!
Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Movie
Dr. Seuss: The Grinch Grinches The Cat in the Hat
Mickey Mouse Clubhouse: Mickey's Adventures in Wonderland
Alvin and the Chipmunks Scare-riffic Double Feature
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
Star Wars: Episode II: Attack of the Clones
Star Wars: Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back
The Fairy Tales of the Brothers Grimm: Snow White / The Wolf and Seven Little Kids
The Adventures of Elmo in Grouchland

title.regular: Buzz Lightyear of Star Command: The Adventure Begins

link.synopsis: In the radioactive wasteland of the future, Sam Hell is one of the last fertile men on the planet. A female organization intent on repopulating kidnaps Sam and sends him on a deadly mission to impregnate a group of beautiful women.
link.title: synopsis
Flesh Gordon Meets the Cosmic Cheerleaders
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension
National Lampoon Presents: The Beach Party at the Threshold of Hell

link.synopsis: Before getting nabbed by the cops, a jewel thief hides a small fortune in stolen goods aboard an empty barge. But when he later returns to claim his loot, he runs into heaps of trouble with the boat's beautiful tenants and a pair of nosy old ladies. Directed by Charles Saunders, this amusing comedy finds the cunning criminal up against far stronger and more resilient adversaries than he ever anticipated.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the White Suit
Don't Worry, We'll Think of a Title
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: Payment in Blood

link.synopsis: Fed up with working hard just to scrape by, Christine Painter (Julie Walters) comes up with a bold plan to become the madam of a brothel and earn her financial freedom: she opens a house of spanking to fabulous reviews. She gets a little help from an experienced prostitute (Shirley Stelfox) and a former Air Force officer with a penchant for lingerie (Alec McCowen). "Monty Python" member Terry Jones directs this comedy based on actual events.
link.title: synopsis
The Happy Hooker Goes to Washington
Legendary Sin Cities: Paris, Berlin and Shanghai

link.synopsis: In this unforgettable 2009 Comedy Central special, accomplished television ("The King of Queens"), film (Balls of Fury) and voice (Ratatouille) actor Patton Oswalt returns to his roots to take the stage for an evening of outrageous stand-up comedy. Oswalt's incisive take on the sins of modern life proves that the new millennium's vices and virtues are just as conflicted -- and just as funny -- as they ever were.
link.title: synopsis
Patton Oswalt: No Reason to Complain: Uncensored
Comedians of Comedy: Live at the Troubadour
The Comedians of Comedy: Live at the El Rey
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
Aziz Ansari: Intimate Moments for a Sensual Evening
The Comedians of Comedy: The Movie
Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
Russell Brand in New York City
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Platinum Comedy Series: The Torry Brothers: A Family Affair
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth

title.regular: Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
title.short: Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong

link.synopsis: This 1936 classic follows Barney (Edward Arnold), a lumberjack who marries for his career even though he loves another woman, Lotta (Frances Farmer). Heartbroken, Lotta settles for Barney's friend (Walter Brennan), with whom she conceives their daughter, also named Lotta. Years later, Barney and his son (Joel McCrea) both grow enamored of the younger Lotta (Farmer), who ends up breaking their hearts. William Wyler and Howard Hawks direct.
link.title: synopsis
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
Rhythm on the Range / Rhythm on the River: Double Feature
Project XX: End of the Trail
St. Martin's Lane / Wings of the Morning: Double Feature

link.synopsis: Shirley Booth (in her film debut) took home a Best Actress Oscar for her superb performance as Lola Delaney, a maudlin, slovenly housewife whose world is shaken by her recovering alcoholic husband (Burt Lancaster) and pretty young boarder Marie Buckholder (Terry Moore). Marie's presence and her  curiosity about her childless landlords set the story in motion in this vintage tearjerker also starring Richard Jaeckel.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Drama)
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Drama)

link.title: Smash-Up: The Story of a Woman
Down the Tracks: The Music That Influenced Bob Dylan
The Last Time I Saw Paris
Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

link.synopsis: When crooner Johnny Cabot (Bing Crosby) enlists in the Navy to escape his swooning fans, he encounters a whole new wave of them -- Navy WAVES, that is -- in this lively World War II musical co-starring Betty Hutton. Tasked with aiding a recruitment drive for the all-female branch, Cabot decides to put on a show. Copious musical numbers follow, including Crosby and Sonny Tufts performing the Oscar-nominated "Accentuate the Positive."
link.title: synopsis
No Time for Love / The Egg and I
The Big Broadcast of 1938 / College Swing
My Favorite Blonde / Star Spangled Rhythm
Rhythm on the Range / Rhythm on the River: Double Feature
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: After falling on hard times, the parents of Joe Carraclough (Roddy McDowall) are left with no choice but to put his adored dog, Lassie, up for sale. The dog is bought by the Duke of Rudling (Nigel Bruce) and looked after by his granddaughter Priscilla (Elizabeth Taylor). Although his new owners are nice, Lassie keeps escaping in order to find his way back to Joe, helped along by farmer Dolly (Dame May Whitty) and handyman Rowlie (Edmund Gwenn.)
link.title: synopsis
Lassie: The 50th TV Anniversary Collector's Edition
Old Yeller / Savage Sam: Double Feature
Kayla: A Cry in the Wilderness
Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure
The Adventures of Milo and Otis
For the Love of a Dog
Rudyard Kipling's The Second Jungle Book: Mowgli and Baloo

link.synopsis: Director Junichi Sato's touching animated film about the relationship between a talking dog named Junkers and an 11-year-old girl named Hiromi was a huge hit in Japan. Faced with the onset of adolescence as well as the impending divorce of her parents, Hiromi finds comfort and reassurance in her relationship with Junkers. Think a Japanese Old Yeller with a twist.
link.title: synopsis
Far from Home: The Adventures of Yellow Dog
Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure
Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit
Stuart Little 3: Call of the Wild

link.synopsis: American expatriate author and composer Paul Bowles -- best known for his influential 1949 novel The Sheltering Sky -- is the subject of this definitive documentary from Canadian director Jennifer Baichwal. While the film's nucleus is an extensive interview with the famously reclusive Bowles, who is surprisingly forthcoming, the highlight is footage of his final rendezvous with fellow scribes Allen Ginsberg and William Burroughs.
link.title: synopsis
The Life and Times of Allen Ginsberg
Jack Kerouac: What Happened to Kerouac?
William S. Burroughs: Commissioner of Sewers
The True Meaning of Pictures: Shelby Lee Adams' Appalachia
Jack Kerouac: King of the Beats
Gang of Souls: A Generation of Beat Poets
20 to Life: The Life and Times of John Sinclair
Shaolin Ulysses: Kung Fu Monks in America
The Documentaries of Louis Malle: ... And the Pursuit of Happiness
Night Waltz: The Music of Paul Bowles
In the Realms of the Unreal
Errol Morris' First Person: The Complete Series
Stanley Kubrick: A Life in Pictures
A Poet on the Lower East Side
Empires: Peter and Paul and the Christian Revolution
The Kid Stays in the Picture
Visual Acoustics: The Modernism of Julius Shulman
Wild Combination: A Portrait of Arthur Russell
Emperor of Hemp: The Jack Herer Story

title.regular: Let It Come Down: The Life of Paul Bowles
title.short: Let It Come Down: The Life of Paul Bowles

link.synopsis: Diana Lorys, Collette Jack and Soledad Miranda star in this sexy thriller about two alluring dancers, Cincia and Anne, who embark on an erotically charged partnership. But when Anne starts to have nightmares that feature her as a murderous killer, she begins to lose her grip on reality. Or is reality merely rearing its ugly head in her dreams? She's determined find out what's causing this turmoil before something deadly happens.
link.title: synopsis
Electronic Lover / The Spy Who Came
Hanna D: The Girl From Vondel Park
A Lizard in a Woman's Skin
Forbidden Photos of a Lady Above Suspicion
Goliath and the Sins of Babylon / Colossus and The Amazon Queen

link.synopsis: Someone has been passing counterfeit cash at the big top, and so our heroes, the Three Mesquiteers (legendary cowboy actors Ray "Crash" Corrigan, Robert Livingston and Max Terhune), join the circus to help find the culprit. Their pal Harris emerges as the lead suspect, but the boys set their sights on Harris's shady partner, Rigby. And as if things weren't complicated enough, Harris's beautiful daughter Nancy (Anne Bennett) enters the picture.
link.title: synopsis
Marshal of Gunsmoke / Oklahoma Raiders / Arizona Days / Trouble in Texas
Winds of the Wasteland / The Lucky Texan
Cowboy Heroes of the Silver Screen
Hopalong Cassidy: Riders of the Timberline / Riders of the Deadline / False Paradise / Unexpected Guest / Wide Open Town
The Outer Limits: The New Series: Aliens Among Us
The Adventures of Jim Bowie: The Complete Collection
The Riders of the Whistling Skull
Hit the Saddle / Call of the Mesquiteers: Double Feature
Gene Autry Collection: In Old Monterey
Hands Across the Border/Billy the Kid Returns
Great Wacky Western Comedies: The Wackiest Wagon Train in the West / Fair Play / The Terror of Tiny Town

link.synopsis: When her husband dies, Mabel Lederer (Estelle Parsons) sells all her possessions, changes her name and begins a brand-new life in a distant town, where she begins strange experiments with the occult. Oscar winner Paul Newman provides the voice of Mabel's late husband, Hughie, in this made-for-television drama based on Shirley Jackson's unfinished novel and marking the directorial debut of Newman's wife, Oscar winner Joanne Woodward.
link.title: synopsis
The Torture Chamber of Dr. Sadism / Death Smiles on a Murderer
Sunshine Superman: The Journey of Donovan
American Short Story Collection: Paul's Case
Thirty Day Princess / Kiss and Make Up
Elizabeth Cady Stanton & Susan B. Anthony
The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp

link.synopsis: After seriously injuring his arm in a major fight, boxer Jimmy Nolan (Regis Toomey) hangs up his gloves and takes a job as a nightclub bouncer. But when Jimmy falls in love with one of the club's dancers (Dorothy Sebastian), he's framed for robbery and sent to prison. Jimmy eventually regains his freedom, but the only way for him to repay his debts is to step back into the ring and fight an unbeatable opponent.
link.title: synopsis
The Land Unknown / The Deadly Mantis
Milky Way / Kid Dynamite: Double Feature
The Last Round: Chuvalo vs. Ali

link.synopsis: On the eve of his return to Denmark, Danish tourist Pelle Juul finds his life unmistakably transformed after sharing a couple of passionate days with a beautiful but very irresponsible Texan waitress named Veronica.
link.title: synopsis
Guy and Madeline on a Park Bench

link.synopsis: With their infectious hip-hop rhythms and kid-friendly ditties, the Figureheads will have your youngsters boppin' to the beat while they learn to connect with one another and discover their individuality with this collection of educational tunes. The group specializes in positive lyrics (based on encounters with children) that can help young people find their place in the world, and the featured songs are sure to inspire kids -- and parents.
link.title: synopsis
Dudu Fisher's Kindergarten: The Friendship Trip
Sesame Street: Guess That Shape and Color
Baby Good Sports: Now I Lay Me Down to Sleep
Baby Good Sports: Thank You for the World So Sweet
Baby Good Sports: All Creatures Great and Small
Miss Patty Cake: Bible Story Sing Along Songs
All Aboard for the Magic Musical Voyage
Hip Hop Kidz: It's a Beautiful Thing
Baby Einstein: Meet the Orchestra: First Instruments
Time-Out Tot: The Behavior Coach: Vol. 1
Baby Einstein: Baby Wordsworth: First Words / Around the House
They Might Be Giants: Here Come the 123s
Baby Einstein: Baby Monet: Discovering the Seasons
Disney's Little Einsteins: Our Big Huge Adventure

link.synopsis: Nicolette (Reebie Sullivan) handpicks the handsome Clay (Christopher Atkins) for her beloved niece, Nikki (Kim Reeves), but the career-minded Nikki isn't too focused on romance at the moment. When Nicolette dies, she continues her matchmaking duties from the other world -- much to Nikki's annoyance. The charming romantic fantasy, co-written and directed by Sullivan, was an official selection at the Aspen Film Festival.
link.title: synopsis
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home
Project Shadowchaser 3000 / Night Siege: Project Shadowchaser II

link.synopsis: As his feminist attorney mother (Karen Jezek) prepares to argue before the Supreme Court in defense of abortion, Christian college student Caleb (Austin Kearney) struggles to determine his stance on this divisive issue, the debate topic of his impending moot court competition. A spiritual drama about doing what is right, this film co-stars Kenneth Jezek as Caleb's pro-life father and Victoria Emmons as fellow student and love interest, Rachel.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
Belle and the Beast: A Christian Romance
The Work and the Glory III: A House Divided
People Who Met Jesus: Series II
People Who Met Jesus: Series I

link.synopsis: Judith Müller (Iris Berben) and her family live a quiet, idyllic country life for many years until one fateful evening when they open their homes to a virtual stranger (Katharina Schüttler) and are forever changed by a hidden past revealed. German director Susanne Schneider takes on the painful subject of terrorism and youth's fateful decisions as she links her two female characters in an emotional and psychological dance.
link.title: synopsis
Heimat 3: A Chronicle of Beginnings and Endings
Vision: From the Life of Hildegard von Bingen
Schoolgirl Report: Vol. 5: What All Parents Should Know
Why Does Herr R. Run Amok?

link.synopsis: In a rural Ohio town, a sophisticated music teacher strikes up an unexpected friendship with a housewife who adores opera. As the like-minded duo spends more time together, their connection grows and begins to transform their lives. Adapted by David Mamet and co-star Rebecca Pidgeon from the novel by Dawn Powell, this romantic tale from director Michael Worth also features William H. Macy and Felicity Huffman.
link.title: synopsis
Masterpiece Classic: A Room With a View
Love in the Time of Cholera
James Patterson's Suzanne's Diary for Nicholas

link.synopsis: Noted director Allan King offers this 1973 documentary that follows a group of disaffected teenagers who jettison life at home and move to a rural farm where they spend 10 weeks free from the perceived repressive structures of family and culture. But as these youngsters experience unprecedented personal freedoms, they discover that life without boundaries does not necessarily usher in the serene counterculture utopia they expected.
link.title: synopsis
Follow My Voice: With the Music of Hedwig
Empire Records: Remix! Special Fan Edition
Daria: The Movie: Is It Fall Yet?

link.synopsis: Quito, the capital of Ecuador, presents a forbidding but seductive setting for this spooky tale revolving around the city morgue and the people who work there -- including a head mortician (Manuel Calisto Sánchez) who feels a strong connection to the "cases" he works. When a murder in the city leads to further tragic events, additional characters are drawn into the strange world of the morgue, and the plot winds into darker and darker territory.
link.title: synopsis
El Rito de la Santa Muerte

link.synopsis: Music-video director Romain Gavras makes his feature-film debut with this powerful drama that traces the unlikely alliance between Patrick (Vincent Cassel), a misanthropic psychotherapist, and Rémy (Olivier Barthelemy), a tormented teenager. Patrick takes the redheaded misfit under his wing, but his motives aren't entirely altruistic -- he enjoys manipulating Remy, and it's not long before the boy's dark side begins to surface.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In the near future, the dreams of three adult siblings living in Germany are fractured by difficult romantic relationships, unwitting involvement with terrorist organizations and the growing worldwide panic over the few remaining oil fields in Asia.
link.title: synopsis
Heimat 3: A Chronicle of Beginnings and Endings
Schoolgirl Report: Vol. 5: What All Parents Should Know
Why Does Herr R. Run Amok?
My Song Goes Round the World

link.synopsis: In this Hitchcock-style thriller, set in 1939 Britain, writer and playboy Desmond Thane meets Anna Raven. Anna is the only woman to hold Desmond's interest for longer than a night -- partly because of a diary he finds in her possession.
link.title: synopsis
Edge of Darkness: The Complete Series
Lord Peter Wimsey Mysteries: Murder Must Advertise
Alfred Hitchcock Shorts: Bon Voyage/ Aventure Malgache

link.synopsis: This reality-style sitcom spoofs the everyday drama and dramatics at a busy British airport, peopled by harried workers and desperate passengers. Series stars Matt Lucas and David Walliams each portray dozens of characters, many of them deranged.
link.title: synopsis
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: Mystery of the Blue Train
Doctor Who: The Waters of Mars
The Best of Ground Force: Garden Rescues
Changing Rooms: Trust Me, I'm a Designer
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: Cards on the Table
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: After the Funeral
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: Taken at the Flood
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: A Great Deliverance
The League of Gentlemen: Christmas Special
Agatha Christie's Tommy & Tuppence: Partners in Crime

link.synopsis: After settling in the tiny Australian town of Walkabout Creek with his significant other (Linda Kozlowski) and his young son (Serge Cockburn), Mick "Crocodile" Dundee is thrown for a loop when a prestigious Los Angeles newspaper offers his honey a job. The family migrates back to the United States, and Croc and son soon find themselves learning some lessons about American life -- many of them inadvertent -- in this comedy sequel.
link.title: synopsis
City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold
Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
The Russians Are Coming, The Russians Are Coming
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1
What's the Worst That Could Happen?

link.synopsis: In director Barry Sonnefeld's Oscar-nominated black comedy, siblings Wednesday (Christina Ricci) and Pugsley (Jimmy Workman) Addams will stop at nothing to get rid of Pubert, the new baby boy adored by parents Gomez (Raul Julia) and Morticia (Anjelica Huston). Things go from bad to worse when the new "black widow" nanny, Debbie Jellinsky (Joan Cusack), launches her plan to add Fester (Christopher Lloyd) to her collection of dead husbands...
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition
The Munsters: America's First Family of Fright

link.synopsis: Writer-director-actor Woody Allen spoofs 19th-century Russian lit (think Tolstoy and Dostoyevsky) in this intellectual comedy -- rumored to be his favorite -- about a faint-hearted hero (Allen) who's drafted for war and convinces his beautiful cousin (Diane Keaton) to marry him. She thinks he's doomed, but he manages to survive a sure-death duel. Now, a plot to assassinate Napoleon is the only thing that can keep them together.
link.title: synopsis
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
The Charge of the Light Brigade
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

link.synopsis: A milquetoast accountant (Daniel Auteuil) is about to get fired from his job for literally being a bore. But at the last minute, a helpful neighbor (Michel Aumont) concocts a "new life" for him as an out-of-the-closet (read: intriguing) homosexual, and suddenly everything changes. Gérard Depardieu co-stars as a homophobic officemate who might be masking a few feelings of his own in writer-director Francis Veber's foreign language comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Jean de Florette / Manon of the Spring

link.synopsis: Jay Paulson, Sam Huntington, Charlie Finn and James Roday star in this rollicking comedy about four brothers who embark on a most unusual road trip. Their destination? A fabled marijuana field bequeathed to them by their hippie-livin' parents. But before they can realize their "high" hopes and dreams, they must first conquer an off-the-wall guru (Rip Torn) and a zealous DEA agent (Kevin Pollack). Thomas Haden Church directs and co-writes.
link.title: synopsis
High: The True Tale of American Marijuana
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back

link.synopsis: Look out, Boss Hogg! The Duke boys are back in this comedy based on the popular TV series, following Bo (Seann William Scott) and Luke (Johnny Knoxville) as they tear around Hazzard County making trouble in their trusty Dodge Charger, the General Lee. Aided by cousin Daisy (Jessica Simpson) and Uncle Jesse (Willie Nelson), the boys must stop commissioner Boss Hogg (Burt Reynolds) and Sheriff Roscoe (M.C. Gainey) from stealing the family farm.
link.title: synopsis
The Dukes of Hazzard: The Beginning
The Dukes of Hazzard: Hazzard in Hollywood
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach

link.synopsis: Despite the popularity of his sitcom "When the Whistle Blows," erstwhile extra and current TV star Andy Millman (Ricky Gervais) longs for respect in the industry. His show is critically reviled, but is he ready to sacrifice his success to follow his artistic dreams? And just how far will he go in the name of personal integrity? Stephen Merchant and Ashley Jensen co-star in the finale of this Emmy Award-winning comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Ricky Gervais: Out of England: The Stand-Up Special
People Like Us: The Complete Series
A Bit of Fry and Laurie
The Worst Week of My Life
The Life and Times of Vivienne Vyle
Not Just the Best of the Larry Sanders Show
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials

link.synopsis: When writer Henry McCarthy (Mark Polish) returns to his high school to give a commencement address 20 years after his own graduation, he finds nothing has really changed: He still harbors the same unrequited crush (Winona Ryder), and he's still in trouble with the principal (Chevy Chase). Hilary Duff, Jon Cryer, Josh Holloway and Sean Astin star in this ensemble comedy helmed by Michael Polish and written by his twin brother, Mark.
link.title: synopsis
Son of Samson / Son of Cleopatra

link.synopsis: Rejected by the Confederate Army as unfit and taken for a coward by his beloved Annabelle (Marion Mack), Johnnie Gray (Buster Keaton) sets out to single-handedly win the war with his cherished locomotive in this classic silent action-comedy. When Northern spies steal his train, the intrepid Confederate takes on the entire Union army to get it back. Keaton's extremely physical performance features a series of acrobatic stunts.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: After several homesteaders are murdered, insurance investigator Rocky (Allan Lane) goes to the Chandler Ranch, where they were supposed to settle, and poses as a cowhand to find out who has been leaking the wagon train routes to the killers. Ranch foreman Nugget Clark (Eddy Waller) joins Rocky in his action-filled quest to prevent more deaths, but young settler Gail Warren (Lyn Thomas) inadvertently reveals Rocky's true identity to the culprits.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Packing plenty of yuks from north of the border, this collection of stand-up routines recorded at the Montreal International Comedy Festival features sets from American funnymen Lewis Black and Jim Gaffigan. Other quipsters in the spotlight include Mitch Hedberg, Bill Burr, "Saturday Night Live" veteran Norm MacDonald and Emmy-nominated musical-comedy duo Flight of the Conchords (aka New Zealanders Bret McKenzie and Jemaine Clement).

link.synopsis: An emotionally empty data-cruncher (Dina Jacobsen) finds her carefully nursed apathy challenged when she's forced into the unknown world of stand-up comedy and apartment hunting in this offbeat offering. Darren Gooding, Lisa Renée and Amanda Orton join writer-director Jacobsen in the cast of this comedy about self-enlightenment and transition.

Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands

title.regular: Coma Girl: The State of Grace
title.short: Coma Girl: The State of Grace

link.synopsis: In his first starring role, Bill Murray plays goofy, puerile camp counselor Tripper, who tries to lure shy camper Rudy (Chris Makepeace) out of his shell. Rudy helps Tripper woo head counselor Roxanne (Kate Lynch) while the campers prepare for a showdown with a rival camp. This cult classic comedy is the first in the series of Murray's collaborations with director Ivan Reitman and writer Harold Ramis that includes Stripes and Ghostbusters.
link.title: synopsis
The Man Who Knew Too Little
Girls Just Want to Have Fun
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise

link.synopsis: Fred MacMurray stars in this comedy classic as Professor Brainard, an inventive but forgetful college instructor who uses Flubber -- a chemical that "lifts" anyone who ingests it -- to perform many wonders. Among many other feats, Professor Brainard is able to boost the basketball team, make a car fly and save his beloved Medfield College! Ed Wynn, Keenan Wynn and Nancy Olson also star in this beloved Disney film.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Lauren Hutton stars as a glamorous vampire who's searching for virgin blood among modern-day Los Angeles high schoolers in this engaging teen comedy that features a very young Jim Carrey as Mark, an inexperienced teenager who's looking for action. He's tempted by the sexy creature of the night, who must sleep with three virgins a year to stay alive. And once Mark gives in, he starts exhibiting strange behavior that worries his chaste girlfriend.
link.title: synopsis
My Best Friend Is a Vampire
